ihs.apcs.spacebattle

Class ObjectStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • ihs.apcs.spacebattle.ObjectStatus

  • public class ObjectStatus
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to represent the status of a ship or other object. This class is used both to represent the current status of your ship in the Environment passed to Spaceship.getNextCommand(Environment) and the status of other objects found by a level 5 (fully-detailed) radar sweep.
    Since:
    0.1

        public int getId()

        Returns:
        a unique identifier for the object

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        String representation of the Type of Object. Could be Ship, Planet, BlackHole, Star, Nebula, Asteroid, Dragon, Torpedo, Bauble, Bubble, or Outpost.
        Returns:
        name of the object's type.

      • getTimeAlive

        public double getTimeAlive()
        Gets the amount of time this object has lived in seconds.
        Returns:
        seconds alive.

      • getPosition

        public Point getPosition()
        Gets the position of this object within the world (0, 0) is the upper-left and increases down and to the right.
        Returns:
        the x, y position in pixel coordinates as a Point.

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Gets this object's current speed. Combine with its direction to get a Velocity Vector.
        Returns:
        current speed in pixels per second

        Returns:

        Returns:

        Gets the current Health of this object. When an object has zero or less health, it is destroyed.
        Returns:
        health remaining.

        public double getMaxHealth()
        Gets the maximum amount of health this object could have. (100 for Ships)
        Returns:
        upper-bound of health value.

      • getEnergy

        public double getEnergy()
        Gets the current amount of energy this object has. This is only provided for your own ship. (i.e. You can't see other ship's energy levels through radar.)
        Returns:
        energy remaining.

        Returns:
        upper-bound of energy value.

        public int getRotationSpeed()
        Gets the number of degrees this Ship can turn in a second (default is 120).
        Returns:
        speed in degrees per second the ship can rotate.

      • getShieldLevel

        public double getShieldLevel()
        Gets the current Shield strength of a Ship.
        Returns:
        shields remaining.

        Returns:
        upper-bound of shield value.

      • getRadarRange

        public int getRadarRange()
        Gets the radius from a Ship object that its radar can detect objects.
        Returns:
        radar radius.

      • getCommandQueue

        public java.lang.String[] getCommandQueue()
        Gets the list of CommandNames your Ship is currently executing. This is only provided for your own ship. (i.e. You can't see other ship's queues through radar.) If the last command requested was a blocking command, it will have finished before this list is populated.
        Returns:
        commands still being executed

      • isInCelestialBody

        public boolean isInCelestialBody()
        Is this object in a celestial object's body of effect?
        Returns:
        true if a ship is in a celestial body's main area of effect (could be false but in gravity well still getAxisMajorLength()). A celestial body will return true if it contains an object like a ship.
        Since:
        1.1

      • isSuccessful

        public boolean isSuccessful()
        Was an object successfully scanned for a game? (Discovery Quest)
        Returns:
        true if this object has a value of success for the current game. i.e. Successfully scanned in Discovery Quest.
        Since:
        1.1

      • getValue

        public double getValue()
        Gets the point value worth of a Bubble, Bauble, or Ship in a Game.
        Returns:
        point value.

      • getNumberStored

        public int getNumberStored()
        Gets the number of cargo items carried by a Ship in a Game.
        Returns:
        number of items/points

      • getHitRadius

        public double getHitRadius()
        Gets the radius of the object needed for collision detection. This tells you an object's radius.
        Returns:
        the radius of the object from its getPosition()

      • getPullStrength

        public int getPullStrength()
        Gets the strength of the gravity or drag of a Planet, BlackHole or Nebula. A higher number represents a stronger effect.
        Returns:
        pull value.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAxisMajorLength

        public int getAxisMajorLength()
        Gets the length of a Planet, BlackHole, or Nebula on its major axis. For Planets and BlackHoles, the Major and Minor lengths will be the same.

        For Planets and BlackHoles this length represents the size of the gravitational field around it. The getPullStrength() method will tell you how much it will effect your ship.

        For Nebula this length is oriented in the Nebula's direction/rotation see getOrientation() and represents its major radius. If your ship is in the Nebula, it will slow down based on the getPullStrength() amount.

        Returns:
        the elliptical radius along the parallel axis
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAxisMinorLength

        public int getAxisMinorLength()
        Gets the length from the center of a Nebula that is perpendicular to the direction/rotation of the Nebula.
        Returns:
        the elliptical radius along the perpendicular axis
        Since:
        1.0

      • getOwnerId

        public int getOwnerId()
        Gets the ID of the Owner of this object. This could be who fired a Torpedo or who owns an Outpost (Bauble Hunt).
        Returns:
        the owner id of this object (if any)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of a Ship object. (may be turned off on the server but see getType())
        Returns:
        a name of a Ship

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
